descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course expands on concepts learned in GEN MUS 252 (Harmony), providing an introduction to form and analysis in music. The class covers such essentials as phrase structure, cadences, tonality and key relations, and large-scale forms, offering students analytical tools for engaging with these aspects of musical structure.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Course Textbook: Jane Piper Clendenning and Elizabeth West Marvin, The Musician's Guide to Theory and Analysis (3rd edition; W.W. Norton, 2016). ISBN: 9780393263053
